document_data.name: Goldenfields
document_data.exports: Food, including grain, rice, wheat, [[herb]]s, [[orange]]s, [[apple]]s, [[corn]], [[barley]], hops, [[pumpkin]]s, [[onion]]s, squash, [[tomato]]es, [[potato]]es, [[radish]]es
document_data.mainbody:
'''Goldenfields''', nicknamed the '''Granary of the North''', was a walled abbey to [[Chauntea]] of spectacular scope and size. It was the most prolific provider of crops, grains and fruits to the people of [[the North]].

The walled temple-complex featured a small town of several dozen longhouses, an abbey, an inn,
document_data.Geography:
The walls and farms of Goldenfields were built on raised land within the [[Dessarin Valley]]  that covered over {{SI|30|mi²|k|long=yes}}.

It was located south of [[Bargewright Inn]], on the western side of the [[River Dessarin]], at the end of the [[Northfurrow Trail]].
document_data.Government:
The complex was originally run by its founder, the [[Chauntea]]n [[cleric]], [[Tolgar Anuvien]].

Sometime during the 14{{th}} or 15{{th}} centuries DR, Goldenfields came under the influence and sway of the [[Emerald Enclave]]. Its members were just as welcome within as faithful Chauntean [[church of Chauntea|clergy]].
document_data.Trade:
The vast farms of Goldenfields grew a number of grains including [[rice]], [[corn]], [[barley]] and hops. It had [[apple]] and [[orange]] orchards along with a number of [[herb]] and vegetable gardens. The latter of these cultivated a number of root vegetables including [[carrot]]s, [[onion]]s, [[potato]]es and others such as [[tomato]]es and squash.

It featured a number of livestock paddocks where oxen and cattle were allowed to graze. Smaller pens housed [[sheep]], pigs, turkey and chickens.

Goldenfields provided much of the food consumed in [[Waterdeep]] and the neighboring settlements, but did not seek payment in return. They donated this food to others in honor of Chauntea.
document_data.Defenses:
The lands around Goldenfields were well patrolled by well-armed Chauntean priests.

The complex was encircled by a massive wall constructed from mortared stone. It was {{SI|60|ft|long=yes}} tall from the outside, {{SI|20|ft|long=yes}} tall from the elevated inside, and {{SI|30|ft|long=yes}} wide nearly all around. Stone towers and barracks were constructed on the walls, about {{SIrange|1|2|mi|k|long=yes}} apart from one another.
document_data.History:
The complex was founded shortly before the {{YearlinkName|1355}}, by Tolgar Anuvien, one of the [[Company of Crazed Venturers|Crazed Venturers]] who hailed from nearby Waterdeep. In the following decade it grew to be the largest "temple" dedicated to Chauntea.

By the {{YearlinkName|1370}}, Goldenfields had grown from {{SI|20|mi²|k|long=yes}}[[Volo's Guide to the North]] and the [[Forgotten Realms Campaign Setting 3rd edition]] show linear growth in the size of Goldenfields, from 20 to 30 square miles. [[Storm King's Thunder]] states the farmlands take up "more than" 20 square miles, which is technically true. 

In the late 15{{th}} century DR, some time after the [[War of the Silver Marches]], Goldenfields was assaulted by a band of [[Guh]], her tribe of [[hill giant]]s and their allied [[goblinoid]] forces.
document_data.Notable Locations:
* [[Earth Mother's Bounty]]: This shop sold seeds and ornamental cornucopias to Goldenfields' visitors.
* [[Goldengulp Brewery]]: Some 60 people worked in the brewery, brewing its [[Goldengulp|namesake beer]].
* [[Harvesthome Abbey]]: The holy house of Chauntea was the largest and most-decorated structure within the complex.
* [[Northfurrow's End]]: This three-story inn offered delectable food and spacious accommodations.

Notable Residents.14{{th}} Century:
* Tolgar Anuvien, the abbey's founder.
* [[Nindil Jalbuck]], one of the [[Masked Lord]]s of [[Waterdeep]].
Notable Residents.15{{th}} Century:
* [[Ellardin Darovik]], the magnanimous abbot of Goldenfields.
* [[Lifferlas]], an awakened tree that dwelled within the orchards.
* [[Miros Xelbrin]], innkeep of Northfurrow's End.
* [[Zi Liang]], one of the abbey's acolytes.

document_data.Rumors and Legends: Local rumors stated that Chauntea herself was quite proud of Goldenfields and had a personal hand in its growth and defense.<ref group="note">Page 45 of [[Volo's Guide to the North]] erroneously refers Chauntea as "he".
